summary: This is an email chain from July 11, 2019, between a reporter and an unidentified recipient, clarifying that Jeffrey Epstein did not have a court appearance that day. The chain references an upcoming Monday hearing before Judge Berman and the due dates for legal briefs.

persons.name: Juliet Papa
persons.context: Reporter for 1010 WINS Radio who is inquiring about Jeffrey Epstein's court schedule on July 11, 2019.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: Presiding judge mentioned in relation to an upcoming Monday hearing for Jeffrey Epstein's case.

events.title: Upcoming Monday Court Hearing
events.description: A court hearing for Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled for Monday at 10:00 am before Judge Berman.

events.title: Defense Brief Due
events.description: The defense brief in Jeffrey Epstein's case is due on July 11, 2019.

events.title: Prosecution Response Due
events.description: The prosecution's response brief in Jeffrey Epstein's case is due on July 12, 2019.

keyFacts: On July 11, 2019, there was confusion among media about whether Jeffrey Epstein had a court appearance that day, which was clarified as not occurring.
An upcoming court hearing for Epstein was scheduled for the following Monday (July 15, 2019) at 10:00 am before Judge Berman.
Legal brief deadlines were active, with the defense brief due on July 11, 2019, and the prosecution's response due on July 12, 2019.
The email chain shows media inquiry and coordination regarding Epstein's court schedule during his 2019 prosecution.
